result.execSummary:
The defendant Joyce A Emond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
No contact with victims or co-defendant (until his criminal case is concluded and if DOC approves).
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Sentence can be served in Manitowoc County. Defendant is responsible for notifying the Door County Jail if sentence is being served in a different county. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

records.addlTxt: from defendant to court regarding her court case.

Defendant Joyce A Emond in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of sentencing recommendation. Arguments regarding no contact conditions. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 2, 3, 4. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2, 3, 4. Counts 1, 5, 6 are dismissed but read in for sentencing along with uncharged Brown County incident. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court orders DNA sample. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Joyce A Emond in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joyce A Emond in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelmininary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim., requests a status in 30 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Joyce A Emond appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears in person.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
